fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Sport, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication, Banking and financial services
head_office_address: c/o Prufag Wirtschaftsprufungs und Beratungs AG, 66 Berderstrasse
eu_initiatives:
We follow key EU policy developments in main EU policy areas including : Financial services, Single Market, Energy, Digital agenda, Audit and non financial reporting. We have also participated to EU consultations which are public on the your EU your voice website http://ec.europa.eu/yourvoice/consultations/index_en.htm 
 
 
Regarding EU audit reform, our principle has been to ensure that legislation would help enhance the quality of audits and financial reporting for the benefit of the Capital markets both within the EU and around the world. 
Looking forward focus will be on monitoring of this legislation across the EU and EEA. Going forward, we continue to engage in debate of areas such as the future role of audit, better corporate reporting, tax and corporate governance. 
 
We also participate in the public procurement of the EU institutions.
source: RTD, EUROPEAID, DGIT, JRC, DG CONNECT, FISMA..,

goals__remit:
KPMG is a global network of professional services firms providing Audit, Tax, and Advisory services to a wide variety of public and private sector organizations. KPMG member firms can be found in 155 countries. Collectively, they employ more than 155,000 people across a range of disciplines. 
 
Please refer to www.kpmg.com for more detailed information.
relevant_communication: KPMG organises events periodically to share information and views on current affairs. KPMG regularly publishes information brochures and articles. We have a dedicated BREXIT team that monitors as well all EU and all Stakeholders in Brussels positions and information on Brexit.
